column4: hi im trying to format a sc card with ubuntu in gparted and i keep getting error
in a terminal... I wanted you to type that.
it says error no such option
remove and reinsert the drive, and give run the command again.
I find your hardware suspect, or your OS itself is flakish. Remove the drive, reboot the machine plug the drive in, do not open it if prompted.
once the machine is up pastebin sudo fdisk -l    and pastebin sudo mount
did you try this drive in another machine
not to be incredibly elementary... but... is the lock tab switched?
please give me the output of the commands I gave you, and we will do just that.

I am tired. It has been over ten minutes since you set to reboot. When it comes up, check sudo fdisk -l   and I expect that it will be /dev/sdb1 where it lives. Then check in mount and make sure it is not there (mounted). Then mkdosfs -I -F32 /dev/sdb1       assuming it is where I expect it.
